segment.source: How to Set Up Periodic Publishing Refresh
segment.target: How to Set Up Periodic Publishing Refresh

segment.source: How to Set Up Periodic Publishing Refresh
segment.target: How to Set Up Periodic Publishing Refresh

segment.source: How to Set Up Periodic Publishing Refresh
segment.target: How to Set Up Periodic Publishing Refresh

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to configure the client to periodically refresh the publishing information from the App-V servers.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to configure the client to periodically refresh the publishing information from the App-V servers.

segment.source: After the client is configured, the refresh operation is automatic.
segment.target: After the client is configured, the refresh operation is automatic.

segment.source: These settings configure the default settings for the client so that all users on this computer will see the same settings.
segment.target: These settings configure the default settings for the client so that all users on this computer will see the same settings.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: After you have performed this procedure, the publishing information will be refreshed according to the new settings after the first refresh at login.
segment.target: After you have performed this procedure, the publishing information will be refreshed according to the new settings after the first refresh at login.

segment.source: When this first refresh occurs, the server might override the computer settings with different settings, depending on how it is configured.
segment.target: When this first refresh occurs, the server might override the computer settings with different settings, depending on how it is configured.

segment.source: The Refresh tab in the Properties dialog box shows the locally configured client computer settings and any settings that might have been configured for the user by the publishing server.
segment.target: The Refresh tab in the Properties dialog box shows the locally configured client computer settings and any settings that might have been configured for the user by the publishing server.

segment.source: To periodically refresh the publishing information from the Application Virtualization Servers
segment.target: To periodically refresh the publishing information from the Application Virtualization Servers

segment.source: Click Publishing Servers in the Scope pane.
segment.target: Click Publishing Servers in the Scope pane.

segment.source: In the Results pane, right-click the desired server and select Properties from the pop-up-menu.
segment.target: In the Results pane, right-click the desired server and select Properties from the pop-up-menu.

segment.source: In the Properties dialog box, on the Refresh tab, select the Refresh configuration every check box and enter a number that represents the frequency in the field.
segment.target: In the Properties dialog box, on the Refresh tab, select the Refresh configuration every check box and enter a number that represents the frequency in the field.

segment.source: Then select Minutes, Hours, Days from the drop-down menu.
segment.target: Then select Minutes, Hours, Days from the drop-down menu.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This setting will cause the client to refresh publishing information every time the configured period elapses.
segment.target: This setting will cause the client to refresh publishing information every time the configured period elapses.

segment.source: If the user is not logged in when it's time to do a refresh, the refresh will take place when the user next logs in.
segment.target: If the user is not logged in when it's time to do a refresh, the refresh will take place when the user next logs in.

segment.source: The timer is then started again for the next period.
segment.target: The timer is then started again for the next period.

segment.source: Click Apply to change the configuration.
segment.target: Click Apply to change the configuration.

segment.source: When you finish configuring the server, click OK to exit the dialog box and return to the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: When you finish configuring the server, click OK to exit the dialog box and return to the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Configure the Client in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console
